concept.title: Introduction
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes about definition of Gmail.

conbody.p: Gmail is a free web-based email service that provides users with 15gb of storage for messages and the ability to search for specific messages. The Gmail program also automatically organizes successively related messages into a conversational thread. Gmail, otherwise known as Google Mail, can be accessed from a personal computer, tablet or any Android or iOS device.

According to Google co-founder and CEO Larry Page, the company was inspired to create Gmail because of a user's letter complaining about problems with existing email services. Their complaints included the constant need to delete messages to stay within storage limits and the lack of searchability.
